SEARCH
Package ui

Class Main

java.lang.Object
ui.Main
public class Main extends Object
Battleship 2D Simluator!. This program simulates a 2D Battleship game, where you can play against the computer. The game has two modes: a standard mode with fixed ship sizes and positions, and a custom mode where you can choose the number of ships, their sizes, and directions. Features: - Place ships on the board (both standard and custom modes). - Take turns attacking the opponent (player vs. computer). - Track wins and losses for both the player and the computer. - See game statistics showing the number of wins for each side. The game uses a command-line interface for interaction and has a simple menu to choose game modes, place ships, and play the game. The program uses the Model-View-Controller (MVC) design pattern: - Model: Contains the game rules, board, and ships. - View: Displays the game board and statistics to the user. - Controller: Manages user input and connects it to the game logic.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

    • menu

      public void menu()
      Displays the main menu and allows the user to select an option. including Standard game, Custom game, Game stats and Exit

    • standardGame

      public void standardGame()

    • placeShips

      public void placeShips(int size, String name, boolean orientation)
      Prompts the user to place a ship of a given size and name on the board.
      Parameters:
      size - The size (length) of the ship.
      name - The name of the ship.
      orientation - True for vertical placement, false for horizontal.

    • playGame

      public void playGame(int numero)
      Manages the game loop for either standard or custom mode. Alternates turns between player and computer, and checks for a winner.
      Parameters:
      numero - 0 for standard game, 1 for custom game.

    • playerTurn

      public void playerTurn()
      Executes the player's turn by asking for coordinates and attacking the computers board

      public void computerTurn()
      Executes the computer's turn by asking for coordinates and attacking the players board

      Displays game statistics for standard and custom games, showing wins for player and computer.
